pullRequest.title: init nucleus boostrap script
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue #, if available:
Description of changes:

Initialize the default nucleus lifecycle bootstrap script when nucleus starts.
Update sample nucleus recipe to be consistent with DeviceConfiguration

Why is this change necessary:
UAT deployment can merge this bootstrap script (e.g. when deploying system setting config). If it doesn't exist already, nucleus restarts which is not expected behavior.
We may want a more elegant solution. If this can only happen in UAT, maybe fix it in UAT package.
How was this change tested:
Run Deployment-12-T1 (deploy polling frequency setting) locally and observe no restart.
Any additional information or context required to review the change:
Checklist:

 Updated the README if applicable
 Updated or added new unit tests
 Updated or added new integration tests
 Updated or added new end-to-end tests

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

nodes.bodyText: We have a constant in Lifecycle.java with lower case "requiresPrivilege". However, actual deployment config has upper case.
why are we setting these heap values?
Can we extract this logic to a method?
Maybe remove this todo. I've removed it from recipes earlier https://github.com/aws/aws-greengrass-nucleus/blob/master/aws.greengrass.Nucleus.yaml

If we initialize with these options, which is definitely right, do we still need defaults in the recipe? Won't the next deployment try to reevaluate the bootstrap script topic with those defaults and restart if they're different from what you get here?
